meanings.sent1: The criminal was sentenced to durance in a small cell.
meanings.sent2: The durance of the prisoner lasted for many years.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat found itself in durance after causing chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt trapped in a durance of worry and fear.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the dungeon enveloped him in a suffocating durance.

meanings.sent1: The old tree showed remarkable durance against the harsh weather.
meanings.sent2: The durance of the friendship between them was unbreakable.
meanings.sent3: Despite its small size, the watch had surprising durance.
meanings.sent4: His love for her had the durance of a timeless bond.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins stood as a testament to the durance of time.
